intro: Pleiarina fangiana, commonly known as the Fang Island pleiarina, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Pleiariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences and striking, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, preferring rich, well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pleiarina fangiana is considered a species of conservation concern.
